p: This chemical collection of pure xanthones (>95%) was submitted to several screenings to discover their biological activities which allowed to build quantitative structureâ€“activity relationship [(Q)SAR] models and to establish pharmacophores for antitumor [ 48], antioxidant [ 49], hepatoprotection [ 50], antifungal [ 29, 51], antibacterial [ 52, 53], antiobesity [ 54], antifouling [ 55] activities and/or targets such as monoaminoxidase (MAO) [ 56], P-glycoprotein (P-gp) [ 57, 58], protein kinase C (PKC) [ 59, 60], tyrosinase [ 61], over these two last decades. Moreover, from these studies several simple oxygenated ( Figure 4) or more complex hit compounds emerged that were additionally investigated in many directions, namely for further molecular modifications [ 62], for their cellular and molecular mechanism of actions [ 63, 64], for their ADMET properties [ 65, 66, 67], for chromatographic applications [ 68, 69] and for their incorporation in nanoformulations [ 70, 71].
